name: Veronica Santangelo
descriptions: Veronica Renata Santangelo is a journeyman scribe of the Mojave chapter of the Brotherhood of Steel, presently residing at the 188 Trading Post in the Mojave Wasteland in 2281. She appears in Fallout: New Vegas as a possible companion of the Courier.
Veronica Renata Santangelo was born into the Brotherhood in 2253 or 2254;

From a very young age (before she was even able to speak, according to her), she demonstrated an aptitude for engineering, taking things apart and putting them back together. This drive and natural curiosity led her to choose the career of a scribe within the Brotherhood, turning her from a tinkerer into an engineering prodigy, in no small part thanks to Elijah's guidance.
As an adolescent, Veronica fell in love with Christine Royce,

Unwilling to leave the Brotherhood behind, when it was Veronica's turn to make the decision, she chose to remain. She believed in what the Brotherhood stood for, or at least the values at the heart of their beliefs.
At first, Veronica was elated to join her foster parent on such an important expedition. However, when Elijah sidetracked the chapter at HELIOS One, she started having doubts.

Despite her relationship with Elijah, she was still a 20 year old scribe with no ability to influence the direction of the Brotherhood. She watched powerlessly as the chapter waged a guerrilla war against the NCR over the next two years. During Operation: Sunburst, the chapter lost half their members, but Veronica survived.
Veronica and Elder McNamara in I Could Make You Care

As the Brotherhood under the newly appointed elder, Nolan McNamara, entered a protracted lockdown to protect themselves from the NCR's Army and Rangers and rebuild its strength, Veronica became an outspoken critic of the Brotherhood's policies. Her difficult questions combined with her status as a veteran of HELIOS One made the leadership uncomfortable. To keep her away from the elder and the bunker heads, she was designated a procurement specialist and permitted outside the bunker to make regular supply runs and obtain provisions and other necessities for her peers.
Some exceptions include Head Scribe Lars Taggart, who tutored her and grew to dislike her attitude,

Being a journeyman scribe, Veronica is responsible for acquiring supplies for the Hidden Valley bunker along with the other duties of a scribe, but relishes her time above ground and to explore life outside of the bunker (as everyone is glad to have her out of the bunker). However, Veronica has become increasingly irritated by what she sees in the Brotherhood of Steel's strict adherence to the Codex

While Veronica's absence from the bunker did keep her out of command's hair, her exposure to the outside world only made her more aware of the Brotherhood's failure. Watching the influx of NCR troops, merchants, and citizens to the Mojave, among other groups, made her realize how the Brotherhood had failed to adapt. The Brotherhood wanted to seize and control military technology so that it could not destroy humanity again. The single-minded pursuit of this goal resulted in stagnation. While the NCR had developed a powerful military and nation, the Brotherhood was stuck in a "hole," unable to carry out its mission,

To Veronica, it did not take a scribe to realize that the Brotherhood would be doomed in the long run. Even with laser rifles and power armor, the Brotherhood's adherence to birth membership meant its numbers would strictly decrease over time,

By 2281, five years after the fall of HELIOS One, Veronica is at her wits' end. Increasingly torn between loyalty to her friends and unwillingness to join them on the funeral pyre of the order, she seeks to learn from the thriving cultures of the wasteland as she collects supplies for the bunker. She hopes to find some sort of solution that could help save the Brotherhood, but her irreverent attitude puts her dangerously close to outright banishment.
The fact that she received a curious note from Father Elijah does not help.

Although she focuses on finding something to force the Brotherhood to change, she also has personal goals to keep her sane. Chief among these is finding a proper dress for herself, something that would allow her to feel like a woman once in a while. She hopes to find a designer gown one day, but until then, she keeps looking.

Veronica is a dedicated, loyal, but frustrated member of the Brotherhood. She views the Brotherhood as her family first and foremost, for good or for ill, since she was raised communally with the death of her parents in the war with the NCR. She was particularly close to Elder Elijah, who took her on as his personal protege, but this relationship became strained as Elijah grew obsessed with uncovering the secrets of HELIOS One and overcommitted resources to its defense. All for what Veronica would later refer to as "glorified artillery."

Veronica was also frustrated when her lesbian relationship with Christine Royce was forced apart by what she believed to be Brotherhood pressure to seek relationships that would result in "reproduction," but also was due to Elijah's machinations.

The young girl became a loud and frequent critic of the Brotherhood's isolationism and adherence to tradition, pointing out that reform was needed since the days of the old wasteland as simply a suit of power armor and a plasma rifle was not enough to reign supreme anymore. This was a fact that was blatantly obvious to her with the sound defeats they suffered against the NCR. Instead, the Brotherhood chose to simply hide in their bunkers and try to outlive their opponents. These loud critiques isolated her from the conservative leadership that refused to even entertain the thought of reform, and so her duties shifted to being the resident "grocer" that would requisition supplies for Hidden Valley anonymously. This job kept Veronica occupied and out of the bunker, while allowing her to interact with surfacers and attempt to learn their ways.

Stubbornly, however, Veronica would insist on making her case for reform, and believed that if she could just showcase the right evidence to the Elders on a major technological blindsight the Brotherhood had missed that she could convince them on the need to change their ways. However, her journey is completely for naught as she ultimately realizes the Brotherhood would choose extinction over breaking with a dying tradition. The revelation devastates her, and she is left with little comfort, and struggles to reconcile her love for the Brotherhood with their intractable stubbornness.
As a response to all these stresses, Veronica has a sharp wit and a sarcastic sense of humor, trying to maintain a chipper attitude, but this belies the seriousness of which she pursues her goals.

Veronica is open about her preference for women, and particularly idolizes feminine women with beautiful dresses of the pre-War era. However she shows no interest in the Courier regardless of their gender or orientation.

After completion of Dead Money, the Courier can retrieve Elijah's holomessage from his terminal in the abandoned BoS bunker and give it to Veronica, but only after exhausting all of Veronica's dialogue options regarding Father Elijah. In the same conversation, the Courier can choose to keep the holotape's knowledge instead, gaining the perk Elijah's Ramblings. Giving Veronica the message will give her the perk Elijah's Last Words.
Veronica Santangelo appears in Fallout: New Vegas and Fallout: Wasteland Warfare.
Veronica's voice actress, Felicia Day, in the voiceover booth

I cannot speak for Chris Avellone (who wrote and directed Dead Money), but I believe we were limited by time/scheduling. Veronica was written and recorded for the base New Vegas game with (IIRC) only a few hooks for Dead Money. I think reactions to Dead Money content itself would have required a more comprehensive level of (way) advanced planning, i.e., we would have needed to know exactly what Veronica was reacting to in Dead Money at the time that we recorded her for New Vegas.

Either that or we would have needed to book Felicia Day for more studio time during the development of Dead Money. That can also be difficult and expensive, especially since voice actors and studio time are generally booked in multiple hour blocks. It’s difficult to justify if the character is only saying two or three new lines.

It also gets a little messy when trying to decide where to draw the line. I think a lot of people would love to see some resolution between Christine and Veronica, but what about Caesar responding to the events of Honest Hearts? I wrote Joshua Graham and directed Honest Hearts, so I can speak more definitively to that. The limited reactivity Caesar could have about JG/HH wouldn’t really justify the expense of bringing John Doman back into the studio. And of course the new dialogue (minor as it might be) would still need to be tested. Caesar had one of the most complex dialogues in New Vegas, so it’s something we really tried to avoid messing with once the game shipped.

topics.topic_text: FollowersAcknowledgeMyOrder
topics.response_text: I buy that.

topics.topic_text: It's time for us to part ways.
topics.response_text: Why does everyone always say that?

topics.topic_text: On second thought, stick with me for a little longer.
topics.response_text: What is this, the Hokey Pokey?

topics.topic_text: I just think we should right now.
topics.response_text: Okay. Then I guess I'll be back at the 188. Maybe digging in some dirt for scrap metal or something.{Guilting.}

topics.topic: FollowersFiredYesSuiteI'd like you to go back to the Lucky 38 for now.
topics.topic_text: I do. We'll meet up at the Lucky 38.
topics.response_text: Nice! Can I order room service?

topics.topic_text: I think we should travel together.
topics.response_text: Let's go make trouble.

topics.topic_text: Let's get going.
topics.response_text: Aw, just when the standing around was getting exciting.{playful, not derisive.}

topics.topic_text: FollowersOverburdened
topics.response_text: Hey, I can't really move, now. But I'll follow you in spirit.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about your tactics.
topics.response_text: Am I punching too much? I get carried away.

topics.topic_text: I want you to change your combat style.
topics.response_text: My recommendation - more punching.

topics.topic_text: I want you to attack enemies the moment you see them.
topics.response_text: You mean like, even more?

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: Yeah. Shake things up a little.

topics.topic_text: That's all. Let's get going.
topics.response_text: Count me in.

topics.topic_text: Switch to a melee weapon.
topics.response_text: You mean like this melee weapon right here in my hand at this very second?

topics.topic_text: I want you not to attack enemies unless I've already engaged them.
topics.response_text: I like this plan where you're the decoy.

topics.topic_text: I want you to use ranged weapons.
topics.response_text: {Hopeful}Does jumping at them with my fists count as ranged?{Then, dejected}<Sighs> Fine.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about how close you're following me.
topics.response_text: What are you saying, exactly?{As though being broken up with, but lightly}

topics.topic_text: Stay close to me.
topics.response_text: Hey, now. You're gonna have to buy me dinner first.

topics.topic_text: Your distance is good. Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: See? I'm good at stuff.

topics.topic_text: All right, you're good. Let's get out of here.
topics.response_text: Good talk.

topics.topic: FollowersTacticsDistanceLongKeep your distance. Try to flank them.
topics.topic_text: Keep your distance.
topics.response_text: They'll never see the haymakers coming.

topics.topic_text: Enough about tactics.
topics.response_text: Yeah. Screw them.{Cheerily jumping on the bandwagon.}

topics.topic_text: Let's trade equipment.
topics.response_text: Ooo. Got something good for me? Is it a dress?

topics.topic_text: Wait here.
topics.response_text: Shoulda brought something to read...

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Leave me alone.

topics.topic_text: PLAYER FIRE WEAPON
topics.response_text: Am I gonna have to take that away from you?

topics.topic_text: PLAYER IN IRON SITES
topics.response_text: Why do we always hurt the ones we care about the most?{wry}

topics.topic_text: PLAYER LAY MINE
topics.response_text: Careful. Someone could trip on that.{calmly}

topics.topic_text: PLAYER THROW GRENADE
topics.response_text: Grenade!

topics.topic_text: Just mad ramblings. He didn't make much sense.(without Dead Money: Abraham wanted to say goodbye, and that he's gone North, into ghoul country.)
topics.response_text: Oh god. He...{sighs}I guess he was lost a long time ago. Even at the end...

topics.topic_text: He explained the search for the Sierra Madre... healed him.(without Dead Money: Abe explained what happened in the Crater, how it healed him.)
topics.response_text: {Drifting, dismissive}Hmm. Unlikely. He was a little too focused on gears and diodes... tech was the cure-all.

topics.topic_text: VDialogueVeronicaAbeMsg1
topics.response_text: Would you mind if I looked at the message?

topics.topic_text: VDialogueVeronicaAbeMsg2
topics.response_text: Would you mind if I listened to the message?

topics.topic_text: VDialogueVeronicaAbeMsg3
topics.response_text: Would you mind if I looked at the message you found?

topics.topic_text: VDialogueVeronicaAbeMsg4
topics.response_text: Would you mind if I listened to the message you found?

topics.topic_text: It's better you don't. Let me hold onto it.(without Dead Money: VDialogueVeronicaAbeMsgRefuse)
topics.response_text: {Irritated}Fine. I guess it doesn't matter anyway, keep it. I won't ask again.

topics.topic_text: Some last words - a message. Nothing important.(without Dead Money: VDialogueVeronicaAbeSim1)
topics.response_text: {Waiting for player to step out of simulator}What was on it? What did he say?

topics.topic_text: Can you unlock it for me first? He was... vague on that point.(without Dead Money: What did you expect a ghoul to say?)
topics.response_text: {Sadly accepting}Yeah. Yeah. Thought as much. He'd been fading away for a long time.

topics.topic_text: I found Elijah.(without Dead Money: I found the ghoul with the Accelerator you were looking for.)
topics.response_text: {Surprise, player found someone she thought was dead}You did? Where? Oh my God, I mean... I thought... I don't even know what I thought might have happened to him.

topics.topic_text: VDialogueVeronicaAcceleratorChokept
topics.response_text: {Default Choke Node}...it doesn't matter. He died when we all retreated to Hidden Valley. I didn't expect to see him again, no one did.

topics.topic_text: I had to kill him.(without Dead Money: I had to kill Monte for it.)
topics.response_text: You killed him?{Beat}But...

topics.topic_text: VDialogueVeronicaAcceleratorStg21
topics.response_text: Did he say anything when you met him? Anything...{about me, stops herself}anything at all?

topics.topic_text: He left this holo-message. Here.(without Dead Money: Here's the accelerator.)
topics.response_text: Where did you get this?

topics.topic_text: You should listen to this.(without Dead Money: You should watch this.)
topics.response_text: {Given a farewell message}All right, I'll listen to it.

topics.topic_text: You should watch it.(without Dead Money: VDialogueVeronicaAcceleratorStg32)
topics.response_text: {Given a farewell message}All right, I'll watch it.

topics.topic_text: VDialogueVeronicaAcceleratorStg33
topics.response_text: {Watched a goodbye message, slightly choked up}That was... that was hard to watch.

topics.topic_text: What did he say to you?(without Dead Money: What did Abraham say to you?)
topics.response_text: {Confused, a little disoriented}The parts I understood? Didn't matter. Past all the garbage, all it amounted to was goodbye.

topics.topic_text: VDialogueVeronicaAcceleratorStg35
topics.response_text: {Still a little dizzy}Sorry... feel a little out of it. Head's spinning a bit...

topics.topic_text: I had to trap him inside a Pre-War... prison.(without Dead Money: I trapped Monte in a subway tunnel, that ghoul's not coming back.)
topics.response_text: Trapped him? Where?

topics.topic_text: VDialogueVeronicaAcceleratorTrapChokept
topics.response_text: {Trapped only}And I don't like saying this, but the Mojave's safer with him... there.

topics.topic_text: Could you help me craft something?
topics.response_text: Step into my office.

topics.topic_text: VDialogueVeronicaDamOutcomeBranch
topics.response_text: Not sure what my parents would think of me fighting for the NCR.

topics.topic_text: VDialogueVeronicaHVEntranceEstranged
topics.response_text: Hey. I, uh, I can't go in with you. I'll wait here, okay?

topics.topic_text: VDialogueVeronicaULDressReceived
topics.response_text: <Gasps> For me? Do you mean it? No, no, it's too much! Well, okay. But it's too much! It's perfect. Thank you. Thank you.

topics.topic_text: Goodsprings.
topics.response_text: Wow, you{emph}have come a long way, then. I've never been there, but I've met some traders who pass that way.

topics.topic_text: The grave.
topics.response_text: Huh. Well, in that case I take it back. You look pretty good, given the circumstances.

topics.topic_text: I'm not entirely sure.
topics.response_text: Yeah, guess the roads must've been long, then, if you forgot where you started from.

topics.topic_text: None of your business.
topics.response_text: That's why I asked. My business is boring. You try trading and scavenging for a living and see if you don't start nosing into other people's affairs.

topics.topic_text: You live in a hole in the ground?
topics.response_text: Well, a bunker, if you want to get technical. I think it sounds more interesting my way.

topics.topic_text: So you just leave your family in the bunker?
topics.response_text: Yeah. I'm not worried. They can handle themselves. But somebody has to get the groceries, know what I mean?

topics.topic_text: Go ahead.
topics.response_text: I had a run-in with this group calling themselves the Brotherhood of Steel. Pretty strange bunch. Do you know anything about them?

topics.topic_text: I'd rather you didn't.
topics.response_text: Forget I said anything, then.

topics.topic_text: Some other time, maybe.
topics.response_text: Sure. It's a small wasteland. I'm sure we'll run into each other again.

topics.topic_text: I met a group of them in a bunker west of here.
topics.response_text: And?

topics.topic_text: They're usually harmless unless you use advanced technology around them.
topics.response_text: Well that shouldn't be a problem for me. I can't afford anything like that.

topics.topic_text: They're enemies of the NCR. If you know where they are you should turn them in.
topics.response_text: Oh my gosh, really? Well, I didn't see where they went, but I'll keep an eye out. Wow, I had no idea they were so dangerous.

topics.topic_text: They've got the right idea.
topics.response_text: Do they? That's a relief. I wasn't so sure, myself. Protecting people from technology seems like a big job for such a small group.

topics.topic_text: I know who they are but I don't care about their agenda.
topics.response_text: Yeah, it's pretty far out, right? Fixating on old technology just doesn't seem very relevant to most people's lives.

topics.topic_text: Yeah. I know to shoot them on sight.
topics.response_text: That bad, huh? Guess I'm lucky I got away with my life. I'll make sure and avoid them from now on. Thanks.

topics.topic_text: Not really.
topics.response_text: That's okay, I wouldn't expect anybody to. I think they tend to keep to themselves.

topics.topic_text: I killed them all.
topics.response_text: God, you're not lying, are you? You really did kill them.{Horrifying realization.}

topics.topic_text: They seemed all right.
topics.response_text: You think? Well good, then. That puts me a little more at ease.

topics.topic_text: I'm reserving judgment.
topics.response_text: That seems wise. I think I am, too. Although for how much longer, I'm not sure.

topics.topic_text: I don't care for them.
topics.response_text: Not very friendly, are they?

topics.topic_text: I've heard they shoot lasers from their eyes.
topics.response_text: Wow. I've got to admit, you have completely defied my first impression of you.{amused at idiocy}

topics.topic_text: The Strip.
topics.response_text: Ooo. Very exciting. Gonna strike it rich, huh?

topics.topic_text: Hoover Dam.
topics.response_text: Huh. Just on your way to do a little heavily fortified sightseeing. Kind of a thrillseeker, aren't you?

topics.topic_text: I just kind of drift from place to place.
topics.response_text: Just wherever the wind takes you, huh? I like that. Keeps things interesting.

topics.topic_text: What's it to you?
topics.response_text: I'll be honest. You're the first person I've run across out here that looks like he can really handle himself.

topics.topic_text: I go where I'm needed.
topics.response_text: Guess we have that in common, then.

topics.topic_text: Going to see an old friend.
topics.response_text: This is quite a journey you're going on, then. Must be an interesting relationship to have brought you all this way.

topics.topic_text: You don't look like much. What do you bring to the table?
topics.response_text: Heh. Good. That's the look I was going for. Trust me on this one, though. You'll be glad you brought me along.

topics.topic_text: Where are you hoping to go?
topics.response_text: Oh, nowhere in particular, really. Just hoping to see more of the world. Looking for a fresh perspective.

topics.topic_text: Okay, let's travel together.
topics.response_text: Now you're talking. One thing you should know, first, though. I asked you about the Brotherhood because I'm one of them.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to, but I can't take you with me right now.
topics.response_text: Aw, you really know how to make a girl feel like a stray cat.

topics.topic_text: Not interested.
topics.response_text: Suit yourself. You can always change your mind.

topics.topic_text: Don't you have a family to feed?
topics.response_text: Like I said, they can handle themselves. And I'm not the only one getting supplies for them. It's a big family.

topics.topic_text: I'm ready to travel with you.
topics.response_text: Good. I hoped you'd come around. Shall we?

topics.topic_text: Actually, I'm more comfortable now that I know you've had some training.
topics.response_text: I'm great at punching people. I'm not gonna lie. It's a gift.

topics.topic_text: As long as you're honest with me from now on.
topics.response_text: Sure. Just don't ever ask me if your outfit makes you look fat.

topics.topic_text: Yes, but you're on a short leash.
topics.response_text: Fair enough. Maybe one day I'll have your complete trust, and I can be on a long leash. A girl can dream.

topics.topic_text: What is it?
topics.response_text: The Brotherhood is failing.{Beat}I've always known that. If we don't change course, we're going to fall apart or... fade away.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about yourself.
topics.response_text: I like long walks in the desert and candle-lit metal workshops.

topics.topic_text: I have questions I wanted to ask you.
topics.response_text: He was dead when I got there.

topics.topic_text: Ever heard of Mr. House before?
topics.response_text: Yeah. They say he built the Strip. Of course, they say a lot of things. No one's actually met him.

topics.topic_text: Can you tell me anything about this platinum chip?
topics.response_text: Yeah. It's not for poker.

topics.topic_text: Ever hear of a guy called Benny?
topics.response_text: Sure, he's one of the hotel managers on the Strip. He comes up in the news now and then.

topics.topic_text: Know anything about New Vegas?
topics.response_text: Yep. It's your typical city layout. Rich people in a gated community surrounded by extreme poverty.

topics.topic_text: What do you think of the NCR?
topics.response_text: I'm worried they'll be the death of the Brotherhood. They take what they want. We defend our interests to the death.

topics.topic_text: Any thoughts about Caesar's Legion?
topics.response_text: Silliest dressed band of raping, slaving marauders you'll see east of California, I'll say that. Where's that touch of Old World class?

topics.topic_text: Never mind.
topics.response_text: Darn it, I had some spectacular answers coming, too.

topics.topic_text: Let's keep moving.
topics.response_text: Let's.{Pleasantly}

topics.topic_text: Not now.
topics.response_text: Okay. Well, when you do, let me know, all right?

topics.topic_text: I'll take you back there, first chance I get.
topics.response_text: Great. Thanks. Thank you. I'll encourage people to name their non-ugly children after you. Seriously.

topics.topic_text: Can it wait?
topics.response_text: Sure, yeah. Just not too long, okay? I worry about them sometimes.{Not the ideal answer she wanted, but going with it, trying to stay upbeat.}

topics.topic_text: Why don't you just go back on your own?
topics.response_text: Wow, don't everybody volunteer all at once now.

topics.topic_text: That's just not important right now.
topics.response_text: This from the girl who walked from I-15 to the Colorado River looking for her lost package.

topics.topic_text: I have things I need to do. You'd better go alone.
topics.response_text: Not much for family gatherings, huh? All right, have it your way.

topics.topic_text: What now?
topics.response_text: I'm not giving up. He wants evidence, but he'll never go looking for it. He's scared I'm right.

topics.topic_text: You think the Elder will listen at all?
topics.response_text: He's a stubborn old man, but when it comes down to it, he's got our best interests at heart.

topics.topic_text: What could we bring to him that would change his mind?
topics.response_text: I don't know. I don't know. We'd need something that shows the Brotherhood will fail. Or that it can do better a different way.

topics.topic_text: So what is it you're trying to accomplish?
topics.response_text: That's my question to the Elder. All these years, the Brotherhood has collected weapons technology. And for what?

topics.topic_text: How would you propose to do that?
topics.response_text: Look at the Followers of the Apocalypse. They use their expertise to improve people's lives. They train them to be self-sufficient.

topics.topic_text: Father Elijah?
topics.response_text: Our Elder before McNamara. He had a nose for recovering lost technology. He'd send Scribes out into the desert chasing whatever leads he found.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the rangefinder.
topics.response_text: It's a targeting device for some kind of doomsday weapon based at HELIOS One. It was lost sometime after the War.

topics.topic_text: Let's head out.
topics.response_text: I'm with you. Being around here isn't the same anymore.

topics.topic_text: Good intentions don't justify marching the Brotherhood to its death.
topics.response_text: No, but it does make it easier to forgive him. He's just misguided.

topics.topic_text: Have you considered that he might be right?
topics.response_text: Have{emph}you considered that he might be senile?

topics.topic_text: What's a pulse gun?
topics.response_text: Electromagnetic weapon from before the Great War. Experimental. It never saw mass production.

topics.topic_text: Farming technology?
topics.response_text: More or less. Supposedly it's a vegetation enhancer. NCR has a science branch headquartered at McCarran airport. Guess they found something.

topics.topic_text: Let's pursue the pulse gun.
topics.response_text: Yeah, maybe they'll think twice about engaging the NCR if they know one of those could be floating around.

topics.topic_text: The rangefinder sounds promising.
topics.response_text: They defended HELIOS like it was their last stand. Didn't even know if there was anything worth defending. How could there be, with all we lost?

topics.topic_text: We should go after the vegetation technology.
topics.response_text: Okay. What better way to persuade them than to give them a taste of what they stand to gain, right?

topics.topic_text: Let's go find it.
topics.response_text: I like the way you think.

topics.topic_text: There was never any chance. His mind was made up from the start.
topics.response_text: I see that now. I thought I knew him better than that. But it was like talking to a stranger.

topics.topic_text: Maybe if we make a stronger case, he'll change his mind.
topics.response_text: No. Our case wouldn't be any stronger if tomorrow they all died when their energy weapons backfired.

topics.topic_text: You just weren't very persuasive.
topics.response_text: Well I{emph}knew he wouldn't listen to{slight emph}me. That's why we went out of our way to find something that he couldn't ignore.

topics.topic_text: The rangefinder might be a problem. I reactivated HELIOS One, and it's not powering a weapon.
topics.response_text: Ah, hell. Well, how could you know, right? Okay. Two other options still on the table.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the Brotherhood of Steel.
topics.response_text: It pays like ass, but it's hard to get other work with my skill set.

topics.topic_text: Would someone else listen to you?
topics.response_text: It wouldn't matter. The Elder has final say.

topics.topic_text: Where does that leave you?
topics.response_text: I...{beat}I don't know if I can stay. Maybe it'd be better for everyone if I left. Spent my life... somewhere else.{This'd be a big deal for her. First sentence is a revelation.}

topics.topic_text: You should take over.
topics.response_text: Ha! Well that's... imaginative. But it's not really for me.

topics.topic_text: What's their purpose?
topics.response_text: Ha! Good question. These days it's hard to say. Once upon a time it was about technology. Controlling it so it couldn't destroy us again.

topics.topic_text: This is your home, and these are your friends. You should stay.
topics.response_text: They may be a bunch of wooden conformists, but anything I did without them would feel... empty.

topics.topic_text: Leaving now is your only shot at a future.
topics.response_text: There's no getting around that, is there? What would my life be like here, knowing what's to come?

topics.topic_text: You're the only one who can make this decision.
topics.response_text: Not even a hint, huh? Geez, I really am all alone on this one.{Sad.}

topics.topic_text: How did you get to be a member?
topics.response_text: More sexual favors than I can even count. I am still tired from it.

topics.topic_text: What do you do for them?
topics.response_text: I'm a procurement specialist. Like I said, it's basically grocery shopping. Except sometimes the groceries are scavenged parts and arcane technology.

topics.topic_text: Do you like being a member?
topics.response_text: I know sometimes I sound like I don't. I know. But there's something that still rings true to me about our code.

topics.topic_text: What's the Codex?
topics.response_text: Ah, the Codex. If it's in there, we have to abide it, if it's not, it's not important.{She has a love-hate relationship with the Codex.}

topics.topic_text: Does the Brotherhood protect people from raiders or other threats?
topics.response_text: No, no. We only protect people from{emph}themselves, and only in the sense that we don't let them have the really good Pre-War toys.

topics.topic_text: How do you feel about the other members?
topics.response_text: I called them family before. That's not far off. Both the good and the bad. It's like a big unending family reunion in that bunker.

topics.topic_text: Who is Father Elijah?
topics.response_text: He was our Elder when we came East. A wizard with technology, really. His mind just worked that way naturally. Learned a lot from him.

topics.topic_text: How can I best use your skills?
topics.response_text: I like punching things, but sometimes shooting things just has to do.

topics.topic_text: I had another question.
topics.response_text: {"Go ahead and ask."}Shoot.

topics.topic_text: I wanted to talk about the technology we're looking for.
topics.response_text: What are your thoughts?

topics.topic_text: Never mind.
topics.response_text: Okay, I won't!{cheerily}

topics.topic_text: Power armor and laser rifles are still effective.
topics.response_text: Yeah, but only if you've got bodies to fill the suits. We don't take on new members. We're all descendents from the original Brotherhood.

topics.topic_text: The Brotherhood is living in the past. Eventually they'll have to change.
topics.response_text: I think you're right. We're getting desperate. Hardly enough people to sustain ourselves as a chapter. They'll see the light, sooner or later.

topics.topic_text: If it's worked for this long, there must be something redeemable about their beliefs. Have faith.
topics.response_text: Wow, you sound like Elder McNamara. I{slight emph}know I should. Hell, it's what I signed up for when I chose to stay into adulthood.

topics.topic_text: None of that is going to change. It's part of the Brotherhood's identity.
topics.response_text: I know the odds aren't good, but I've gotta try. I can't lose them.

topics.topic_text: Why don't you do something about it?
topics.response_text: I don't know. I'm still thinking about what kind of role we could take on that would give us the best chance of survival.

topics.topic_text: The Brotherhood has to isolate itself. Its knowledge is dangerous.
topics.response_text: Sure, but how long before the NCR or Caesar's Legion track us down and take it by force anyway?

topics.topic_text: Are you still going to travel with me?
topics.response_text: Yeah. I've got the rest of my life to help them out. I can spare a little while to see things through with you.

topics.topic_text: It's not too late to change your mind.
topics.response_text: No, I think it is. I have to be resolved about this. If I waver, it'll just make things harder.

topics.topic_text: Will they take you back after you killed these people?
topics.response_text: I think so. Two things the Brotherhood has a lot of - hardheads and lasers. Wouldn't be the first time a disagreement ended like this.

topics.topic_text: Come on. Let's get out of here.
topics.response_text: {Somber}Good idea.

topics.topic_text: You're sure you're okay leaving them behind?
topics.response_text: Yeah. I think if I stayed I'd end up causing trouble. Sometimes I just can't help myself.

topics.topic_text: Maybe you should've stayed at Hidden Valley.
topics.response_text: Well, I shouldn't have come within a mile of here. I know that.{Beat}These poor people.

topics.topic_text: You don't control the people who did this.
topics.response_text: {Not taking comfort}No... I don't, do I? If I did, none of this would've happened.

topics.topic_text: These people are dead because you were careless and selfish.
topics.response_text: {Sad, peeved}Isn't that what I just said? I know I'm responsible.

topics.topic_text: You can just join the Followers somewhere else.
topics.response_text: No. Not a chance in hell. I'm not risking this happening again.

topics.topic_text: Who are the Followers of the Apocalypse?
topics.response_text: Okay, so take the Brotherhood. Replace their knowledge of superweapons with half as much knowledge of medicine and farming.

topics.topic_text: What are your goals?
topics.response_text: I want... a dress.

topics.topic_text: Who was this Father Elijah to you?
topics.response_text: I would say he was my tutor, but that doesn't cover it.

topics.topic_text: Do you have any other family in the Brotherhood?
topics.response_text: Just my parents, but they haven't been around for a long time. Dad was a Paladin, Mom was a Scribe.

topics.topic_text: Are you well respected among other members of the Brotherhood?
topics.response_text: If you take trying to keep me as far away from Hidden Valley as possible because I ask too many difficult questions as a sign of respect,{"absolutely"}oh yeah.

topics.topic_text: A dress?
topics.response_text: Yeah! A good one. Something elegant and classy, you know? But still stylish.

topics.topic_text: Tell me something else about you.
topics.response_text: Can I make it up?

topics.topic_text: That's your goal? You want a nice dress?
topics.response_text: Hey, you try getting a date wearing Scribe robes. Might as well be wearing sweatpants.

topics.topic_text: Where is he now?
topics.response_text: I don't know. Last time anyone saw him was in the battle at HELIOS One. I wasn't there.

topics.topic_text: Were you close?
topics.response_text: Yeah. I miss him.

topics.topic_text: What did you learn from him?
topics.response_text: Elijah could look at an old device and immediately understand what made it work. And he could see its potential. Where it fit with other technology.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: {Elongate the 'o'}Okay.

topics.topic_text: How is that different? What did you learn from him?
topics.response_text: I learned what I don't want to become.

topics.topic_text: What was in the note?
topics.response_text: It was... strange. Even for Father Elijah. He's always been unstable, but this was... something else.

topics.topic_text: Did you follow him from California?
topics.response_text: It was by his request, actually. He cleared it with the other Elders.{To herself}Somehow.{Veronica says the last part to herself b/c she doesn't understand how Elijah was able to convince the Elders (he tricked them).}

topics.topic_text: What changed?
topics.response_text: {Emph}He did. For years, he fought with the Council. Taught me to question our direction. Meanwhile he'd become more out-of-touch than all of them.

topics.topic_text: Ever try to talk sense into him?
topics.response_text: {Sadly}Yeah, I did. I couldn't help him.

topics.topic_text: How is that different from how any other Elder would've reacted?
topics.response_text: They're cautious. When they discover something, they respect it, learn its limits, consider how to preserve it. Used to drive Father Elijah crazy.

topics.topic_text: Why is the Brotherhood interested in Nevada?
topics.response_text: It was the Dam, really. We'd heard rumors it was working. Figured we could claim it, put it to use.

topics.topic_text: Ever been in love?
topics.response_text: {Playful}Ever been nosy?

topics.topic_text: What happened?
topics.response_text: She left the Brotherhood. Wanted to put some distance between herself and her parents.

topics.topic_text: You didn't go with her?
topics.response_text: No. Couldn't bring myself to leave everyone else behind. Couldn't convince her to stay, either.

topics.topic_text: I want to discuss other things.
topics.response_text: Ooo. Got any juicy gossip?

topics.topic_text: Sure, teach me.
topics.response_text: All right, put 'em up. Let's see what you got.

topics.topic_text: Not right now.
topics.response_text: You sure? Some other time, then.

topics.topic_text: Anything else?
topics.response_text: Yeah. I've been taking things apart and putting them back together since before I said my first word.

topics.topic_text: Is there someplace you wanted me to take you?
topics.response_text: Nowhere specific. I just know there are a lot of groups who're actually doing well for themselves out here.

topics.topic_text: Okay.
topics.response_text: Don't take too long, all right?

topics.topic_text: I changed my mind. I'm not going inside, either.
topics.response_text: Thanks. Wasn't wild about sticking around here on my own.

topics.topic_text: VEndingVeronica
topics.response_text: {Narration}At odds with leadership over the Brotherhood's future, Veronica looked to the Mojave Wasteland for an answer both she and they could live with.

conversation.response_text: See you around.

Huh. Figured it'd have more buttons and dials and stuff, you know? Oh, well. It's still the electronic equivalent of a disease from Gomorrah.
He's got no resources but a decent cause. We've got plenty of resources and a totally lost cause.
<Gasps> For me? Do you mean it? No, it's too much! Well, okay. But it's too much! It's perfect. Thank you. Thank you.{Genuinely touched.}

I brought you a present.

{Horrified disbelief}Oh no.{Quickly}No, no, no, no, no, no.

{Critically Injured}I'm gonna need some new limbs.
